headline: Asian markets stumble as traders struggle to hold Fed cut rally
summary: Asian markets struggled to maintain their early momentum Thursday, even after the latest batch of US data reinforced expectations that the Federal Reserve will cut interest rates for a third successive time next week.The reading was also the most since early 2023 and is the latest example of a stuttering labour market.

content.title: Asian markets stumble as traders struggle to hold Fed cut rally
content.summary: Asian markets struggled to maintain their early momentum Thursday, even after the latest batch of US data reinforced expectations that the Federal Reserve will cut interest rates for a third successive time next week.The reading was also the most since early 2023 and is the latest example of a stuttering labour market.

thumbnail.caption: Tokyo was a standout performer amid a selloff across most of Asia (GREG BAKER)

headline: Dollar Stays Weak as U.S. Rate Cut Bets Weigh
summary: The dollar rose against a basket of currencies but stayed weak after reaching a five-week low in the previous session on boosted rate-cut expectations.

content.title: Dollar Stays Weak as U.S. Rate Cut Bets Weigh

headline: FTSE 100 LIVE: London underperforms against peers as latest US data confirms Fed rate cut expectations
summary: Bets on a US interest rate cut have risen to around 90% as Fed officials signal that protecting jobs now takes priority over squeezing lingering inflation.

headline: Markets mixed as traders struggle to hold Fed cut rally
summary: Asian and European markets were mixed Thursday after the latest batch of US data reinforced expectations that the Federal Reserve will cut interest rates for a third successive time next week.However, while market players remain confident that the Fed will continue to cut interest rates into the new year, economists at Bank of America still had a note of caution.

content.title: Markets mixed as traders struggle to hold Fed cut rally
content.summary: Asian and European markets were mixed Thursday after the latest batch of US data reinforced expectations that the Federal Reserve will cut interest rates for a third successive time next week.However, while market players remain confident that the Fed will continue to cut interest rates into the new year, economists at Bank of America still had a note of caution.

headline: Stock Futures Mostly Lower as Rally Pauses Ahead of Key Inflation Data
summary: Stock futures were struggling for direction on Thursday, with Wall Street in wait-and-see mode ahead of an inflation print that could be key for determining the Federal Reserve's rate-cutting path.  The three major indexes all closed in the green Wednesday after the ISM services report suggested an easing of inflation pressures, and private-payrolls data from the ADP signaled a softer-than-expected labor market.  Both strengthen the case for the Fed to lower rates.

content.title: Stock Futures Mostly Lower as Rally Pauses Ahead of Key Inflation Data
content.summary: Stock futures were struggling for direction on Thursday, with Wall Street in wait-and-see mode ahead of an inflation print that could be key for determining the Federal Reserve's rate-cutting path.  The three major indexes all closed in the green Wednesday after the ISM services report suggested an easing of inflation pressures, and private-payrolls data from the ADP signaled a softer-than-expected labor market.  Both strengthen the case for the Fed to lower rates.

headline: Heard on the Street Wednesday Recap: Betting on Cuts
summary: The Dow industrials added 0.9% and the Nasdaq composite gained 0.2%.  New data from ADP showed the private sector shed 32,000 jobs in November.  The "modest fall" should be enough to persuade Federal Reserve policymakers to vote for another rate cut next week, said Stephen Brown of Capital Economics.

content.title: Heard on the Street Wednesday Recap: Betting on Cuts
content.summary: The Dow industrials added 0.9% and the Nasdaq composite gained 0.2%.  New data from ADP showed the private sector shed 32,000 jobs in November.  The "modest fall" should be enough to persuade Federal Reserve policymakers to vote for another rate cut next week, said Stephen Brown of Capital Economics.

headline: ING Flags Upside Potential in 10-Year U.S. Treasury Yield
summary: "Treasuries love that 4% to 4.1% trading range. Temporary break below more likely. But break above has more legs," the Dutch bank said.

content.summary: "Treasuries love that 4% to 4.1% trading range. Temporary break below more likely. But break above has more legs," the Dutch bank said.

headline: Stocks rise eyeing series of US rate cuts
summary: European and Asian stock markets mostly rose Thursday after the latest batch of US data reinforced expectations that the Federal Reserve will cut US interest rates next week and into 2026."The most immediate source of volatility remains the¬†US Federal Reserve," they wrote.

headline: Treasury Yields Rise as Fed Rate Cut Priced In
summary: U.S. Treasury yields rise in midday European trade as markets have largely priced in a 25-basis-point interest-rate cut by the Federal Reserve next week. Wednesday's November U.S. ADP private payrolls report was weak and "appears to have shortened the odds of the Fed delivering the now widely expected 25 basis-point rate reduction next week," First Abu Dhabi Bank analysts say in a note.

content.title: Treasury Yields Rise as Fed Rate Cut Priced In
content.summary: U.S. Treasury yields rise in midday European trade as markets have largely priced in a 25-basis-point interest-rate cut by the Federal Reserve next week. Wednesday's November U.S. ADP private payrolls report was weak and "appears to have shortened the odds of the Fed delivering the now widely expected 25 basis-point rate reduction next week," First Abu Dhabi Bank analysts say in a note.

summary: World stock markets mostly rose Thursday after the latest batch of US data reinforced expectations that the Federal Reserve will cut US interest rates next week and in 2026.Kathleen Brooks, research director at XTB noted that "there seems to be one main driver for stocks this year: an increase in expectations of a Fed rate cut next week.

headline: U.S. Weekly Jobless Claims Fall to 3-Year Low Ahead of FOMC Meeting
summary: The weekly jobless claims have fallen to its lowest level in over three years, a development that could allay fears over a weakening labor market. This comes ahead of the FOMC meeting, where the Fed is likely to lower rates, which is a positive for Bitcoin and the broader crypto market. U.S. Weekly Jobless Claims

headline: Treasury Yields, Dollar Get Support From Labor Data
summary: Treasury yields and the dollar rise as data show layoffs falling in the U.S. Weekly jobless claims drop to 191,000 from an upwardly revised 218,000. The number is well below the 220,000 forecast by economists in a WSJ survey, and the lowest since September 2022.

content.title: Treasury Yields, Dollar Get Support From Labor Data
content.summary: Treasury yields and the dollar rise as data show layoffs falling in the U.S. Weekly jobless claims drop to 191,000 from an upwardly revised 218,000. The number is well below the 220,000 forecast by economists in a WSJ survey, and the lowest since September 2022.

headline: Bond Investors Cast Doubt on Hassett as Fed Chair
summary: Some bond investors are worried that Kevin Hassett would cut interest rates too aggressively according to the Financial Times. President Donald Trump has signaled Hassett will be his choice to replace Chair Jerome Powell. Ed Mills of Raymond James and Nela Richardson of ADP talk about Trump's choices on "Bloomberg Surveillance."

President Donald Trump has signaled Hassett will be his choice to replace Chair Jerome Powell. Ed Mills of Raymond James and Nela Richardson of ADP talk about Trump's choices on "Bloomberg Surveillance."
